headline: BBQ Chicken Pizza
description: This BBQ chicken pizza is loaded with diced chicken, spicy barbecue sauce, pepperoncini peppers, onion, and cilantro, topped with Colby-Jack cheese.
name: BBQ Chicken Pizza
recipeIngredient: 2 skinless boneless chicken breast halves, cooked and cubed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Place pizza crust on a baking sheet. Spread barbeque sauce on crust. Top with chicken, pepperoncini peppers, onion, and cilantro. Cover with Colby-Jack cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and bubbly, about 15 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Very easy recipe to make quickly. I used Sweet Baby Rays BBQ Sauce. Thin crusts work well also.
Good but doogh was soggy

Excellent! I used a standard BBQ sauce instead of a spicy one. When cooked, it had a tangy taste with just a little kick, which is easier for a large group to enjoy.

For the cheese I went with a blend of mozzarellas, Romano, and fontina.
I made this pizza over the weekend. It came out great and was easy to make. I will make it again.
I made this pizza over the weekend. It came out great and was easy to make. I will make it again.
I used my own favorite BBQ sauce, but this pizza turned out so good! I also made my own pizza dough, but I have used pre-baked pizza crusts before and they are very good as well.
good

Recipe is good as a base recipe but I honestly didn’t pay much attention to the measurements, I just went my chefs intuition for it & it came out great. I made my own pizza dough & put some thyme & basil over it before i prebaked it for 10min. As for the bbq sauce I took normal original flavor bbq sauce & added a bit of wostershire sauce, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, black pepper, some green (jalapeño) tobassco sauce, & a dash of sugar, then heated it for 30sec in the microwave. For th chicken I boiled a chicken breast in some water with salt garlic & olive oil till is was cooked just enough to shred. Shredded the chicken & mixed it in with some of the bbq sauce. Next put the sauce on the pizza, then the chicken, then red onion slices, topped with mozzarella, then put chopped spinach and cilantro, topped with a bit more cheese and some fresh diced jalapeños. Came out really good!
I put bbq sauce,the cheese and then all the fixings,was spicy but realllllly good!!!
Not bad. Way too much cilantro and not nearly enough vegetables for my taste. I do love pepperoncini and chicken on a bbq sauce based pizza though!
Not bad. Way too much cilantro and not nearly enough vegetables for my taste. I do love pepperoncini and chicken on a bbq sauce based pizza though!
A great change to use that leftover chicken.
Had Nann bread on hand. Very good!
Less cilantro and BBQ sauce...or get a bigger pan
So good! It tasted like a professionally made pizza. I did alter the cilantro and peppers since they seemed a little much.

Every one tops their pizzas different. I used all the ingredients in this recipe, to my liking. The very thinly sliced onion, pepperoncini's, cilantro and stubs spicy bbq sauce made this over the top! Is now one of my favs!

We liked this pizza with few changes. I made my own pizza crust and pre-baked it for 10 minutes at 400. 
I used green bell pepper for pepperoncini. I wanted the taste of chicken to be predominant so I used only half the amount of the vegetables.

This is a really great recipe how do I did a few different things. I bought go balls from the local pizza place here in my town. If you want deep this you really need to let it rise I use cast-iron skillets let the doughballs rise for about an hour. I used Monterey Jack cheese it does really well contrasting between the sweet barbecue sauce. I also use cast-iron skillets to cook them. Turned out delicious. I will be making this quite a bit there was no pizza left!!!!!

We love this! I've never added the pepperoncinis as my husband is not a fan. I just serve them on the side. I add thinly sliced green peppers, mushrooms, and spinach. This pizza is quick, easy, and leftovers are great!
Simple and quick. We loved this for dinner. If you're looking for a great sauce for this, we picked up 'Neal Brothers' chicken and rib. perfect on this

This is a great recipe and I have tried it I have cooked it though I am 14 years old and I got help from my mother and I really Enjoyed making it and everyone loved it. I was happy to know this recipe and i have made first 2 pizzas and then I have made 3 pizzas.
Overkill with a cup of bbq sauce.
I loved this! New favorite food. I left of the pepperoncini peppers though bc I'm not a fan of them. But terrific tasting, easy, and quick.

This is a great recipe as it stands. I BBQ the chicken breasts first. I already had a pound of frozen/refrigerated pizza dough, so I substituted that, divided it into 3 pizzas and BBQ them - see the pictures. By making three, I was able to not add items that others might not like. I also used sliced banana peppers because that is what I had and they worked fine. I followed the remainder of the ingredients, then I BBQ the pizzas and they came out wonderful. I'm sure you could also BBQ using the pre-made pizza crusts and it would be good, too.
Quick and easy! I added some bell peppers and subbed mozzarella cheese instead of Monterrey (personal preference). Will definitely make again.
Easy peasy and yummy! I always like to rub a little olive olive oil on both sides of the pizza crust. Way better than CPK! We GRILLED it!

Excellent base recipe, though I think the ingredient quantities are meant for 2 12" pizza crusts. I cooked a couple of chicken breasts in the oven and then diced them and coated the diced chicken with bbq sauce (to keep the chicken from drying out). I usually use Sweet Baby Ray's Honey Chipotle bbq sauce with this recipe, but I have also used regular bbq sauce mixed with a little bit of hot sauce. Also, I think adding some smoked gouda cheese brings this recipe to the next level! As most reviewers have said, leave the little peppers as a side. Great recipe, thank you!
I made this for my family and we LOVED IT!! I highly recommend this recipe. We used 1/4 cup of mozzarella cheese and 1/3 cup of cheddar cheese.

Very nice. I used up some leftover baked chicken and homemade bbq sauce from AR. I cooked the onions first for personal preference. What a good idea and nice change from a bbq chicken sandwich. Thank you KimiRae!
Left out the peppers and substituted mozzaralla cheese - Still delicious! Used Weber's bbq sauce - we liked it!

Yumm!! Who knew BBQ chicken pizza could be so easy!! I used left over chicken and added a bit of bbq sauce to it, and omitted the pepperchinis. I used cheese on hand, mozzarella and cheddar. Layered and cooked as it says, came out GREAT!! Thanks!
a little too sweet on the sauce, I will use a spicier sauce in the future, otherwise pretty good!

Used what I had left in the kitchen. Mexican mix of cheese, can of chicken breast in water, cheep BBQ sauce, etc. Came out so good husband said I should open a pizza place! I did make the crust from scratch but we will do this again!

Tried and loved it! Used a little less BBQ sauce because the wife doesn't like a saucy pizza. Also pre-baked the crust for about 8 minutes, brushed the crust with olive oil, and added fresh garlic. It was an instant it. Family can't get enough of this one.
go easy on the BBQ sauce...delicious flavor!
Yummy!
I cut out the pepperoncinis and added seeded and diced tomatoes. It was a wonderful switch out! I also used mozzarella instead of monterey jack. Overall the pizza turned out very nicely. :)

Awesome recipe. I left off the peppers and added bacon. Used a thin pizza crust and cooked it for a few minutes on a baking stone before topping it. My husband loved it - only suggestion would be to water down the bbq sauce a little so it doesn't sweeten up as much!

I literally made this pizza 2 days ago and omg it was amazing! It was my first time making a pizza too so I was worried but it came out perfect. I love it and will be making it at least once a month for my family because of my family's request for it. I added sausage to mine and I didn't put the cilantro on it because the cilantro went bad in the refrigerator but next time I will might add cilantro if I remember because the pizza was so perfect that I kind of don't want to change it even though cilantro would be such a small adjustment.

This is a terrific, quick meal that my whole family really likes. I add some BBQ sauce to the chicken while it is cooking to add a little flavor, as well as some garlic and spices to dress it up. The amount of cilantro is a bit much, so I adjusted that, too.
YUMMMMMY

We loved it, but I had to change several ingredients because of our tastes & what was in the pantry: No Cilantro- we don't like that stuff. I used VIdalia onions, plain ordinary barbecue sauce and no peppers, and I guess my eyeglasses were dirty so I saw pepperoni & I substituted diced sausage for that- The cheese was a combination of mozzarella, cheddar, and monterey jack with jalepenos. I sprinkled the chicken breasts with "Everglades" and something called "Mojave Fajita seasoning Red" before sauteeing in a non-stick pan covered with cook spray & a splash of Chicken broth. I had a Pillsbury crust in the fridge so I pre-cooked that according to directions and after browning the chicken I cooled it and diced to bite size. It was set aside and the sliced onions were sauteed in the same pan with a lil cook spray & chicken broth.Last I added the diced sausage. Finally, I piled the chopped chicken, onions, diced sausage, 3/4 cup o BBQ sauce & another splash of chicken broth back into the pan & stirred until the consistency of the whole thing looked "right". I spooned that combo onto the pre baked "crust" and piled on all that delicious shredded cheese blend. It ROCKED. It really hit the spot.The Fajita seasoning made up for the difference between spicy & "plain" BBQ sauce. I'm going to make it again -closer to the recipe (Still no Cilantro) .IT's a great addition to my recipe library! Thanks :-)
Excellent!! We cooked ours on the green egg grill but followed the same recipe just adding a few more veggies such as peppers, spinach, and tomatoes. It was fantastic!!

This was delicious and the only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was because the proportions are so off. I used two chicken breast fillets and I just cut them up, sprinkle them with season all and threw them in the skillet. I used about 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro, half a small red onion, thinly sliced, 1 cup of the Colby jack cheese and about 1/2 cup Sweet Baby Rays BBQ sauce. I only put banana peppers on my slice because my husband isn't a fan but this was fantastic! Super easy to make, it had wonderful flavor and I think it's just as good if not better than California Pizza Kitchen. I'm definitely making this again! I just wish I hadn't spent so much time messing with the amounts but now I know!
Great recipe! We make this with leftover grilled chicken from the night before, skip the peppers, and serve it with salad. Easy and yummy summertime meal!

I made my own yeast pizza crust and then used my judgement as to how much of each topping to put on. I baked in a 450 oven until brown enough to suit me. I did use approx 1/4 cup pepperoncini peppers chopped finely. Left off the cilantro. Really good pizza if you use your own judgement with amounts of ingredients. I also cooked two chicken breast fillets in a little butter and seasoned with salt and pepper then cubed. Four stars as written because of excess in ingredients...five stars with these changes.
My husband and I made this recipe exactly as listed and it was great. Next time I will either make a pizza crust or buy a refrigerated one instead of the pre-baked crust.
it was really good, just dont use that much sauce or cheese... overload!!!!! but it was good 4 stars!!!
Used my own judgement on the amount of BBQ sauce and it turned out great. Kids loved it!

I used "Quick and easy pizza crust" recipe from this site (with spices added into it), roasted some mushrooms and red onion with olive oil/garlic/thyme, shredded bbq chicken, deli mozzarella, and a little shredded cheddar and spinach.

After reading all the reviews I was a bit conflicted about how to proceed. So, I reverted to the half and half approach. On one half of the pizza, I followed the basic intent of the recipe. I used shrimp instead of chicken, a substitution I often make. And, I used a mix of colby and pepper jack for the cheese. I also added a bit of freshly chopped garlic to the crust before adding the sauce. The combination of flavors is excellent and for us the amounts are off. I used only 1/2 cup sauce on the entire pizza and it was plenty - one cup would have been way too much for our tastes. I also cut down on the amounts of all the other ingredients. I guess I tend to take a 'less is more' approach to pizza toppings. Adjusted for the half of the pizza, I used only 1/2 the amount of sauce and probably 1/3 the amount of the other ingredients listed in the recipe. On the second half I subbed a mix of mozzarella and colby, and I left off the pepperocini and subbed carmelized onions for regular. That half was also excellent - a far more mellow approach. Of the two, we preferred the original combination of flavors designated in the recipe - just at much smaller amounts. Flavor = 5 star, amounts = 3 star for an average of a 4.

This pizza is so easy to make. I had to make four of them for a group of 10 and everyone was raving about them. Only change was taking one of the reviewer advise and soaking the chicken in bbq sauce before putting on the crust. Thanks for sharing.
Just OK, lacked flavor.
My daughter and I loved this. I put it on a boboli pizza crust, and used green peppers instead of pepperoncini peppers. I would definitely make this again. YUM!

This was amazing....used a Boboli crust, Sweet Baby Rays BBQ sauce (our fave), a container of Lloyds BBQ shredded chicken, red onion, green peppers sliced thin instead of the pepperoncini and the Colby/Jack cheeses.....just delicious, messy and and very easy. Made this on the grill. Thanks!

Delicious after I made a few tweaks! I used my own whole wheat pizza dough I made myself, and brushed the pan with olive oil, sprinkled with garlic salt and Italian seasonings. I really enjoy that flavor of Bull's Eye Original BBQ sauce and it doesn't have any high fructose corn syrup in it. The taste of the BBQ sauce really matters. I also sometimes use mozzarella cheese instead, and it is still wonderful! Great recipe, and I get a ton of compliments on how tasty it is!

My husband says this is the best pizza I've ever made! I only used 1 chicken breast (and it was plenty!). I added 3 strips of cooked bacon (chopped up), and I carmelized the onions in a frying pan before adding them to the pizza. Sweet Baby Ray's Honey Chipotle bbq sauce has just the right amount of heat. I used a shredded 4 cheese Italian mix. I buttered the whole crust, slathered in minced garlic, and baked for a few minutes before adding the toppings. YUM!

Delicious and quick! Followed recipe, but used a store bought pizza blend (mozzarella, asiago, Parmesan, and smoked provolone) for the cheese. Also followed other reviewers suggestion of baking the chicken to keep the juiciness and it worked!
I could literally taste the cilantro from down the hallway in my apartment. The cilantro and onions were overwhelming and I didn't even use the full amounts. I just wasn't digging this, sorry.

Worst homemade pizza I've ever had. I agree on the ingredients to go in it as I've made something similar. The amount of ingredients stated for this made it taste like a pile of hot garbage. I've made BBQ chicken pizza before and it is much easier to gauge how much you put in it by eye. Good ingredients. Awful amounts. Also I recommend 
buying dough from a pizza shop. I make (great) homemade pizza frequently and this is by far the worst one I've had. Gauge the ingredients by eye.

Love it! I use two packs of generic pizza dough mix (for a slightly thicker crust, which I pre-bake a bit first), and two medium chicken breasts. Cook and dice the chicken & coat with BBQ sauce first before adding to the pizza. I omitted the peppers completely and use an Italian seasoning on it before baking instead of the cilantro, which I rarely have on hand. I eyeball all of the ingredients and it comes out delicious!
My husbands favorite pizza is bbq chicken pizza. I have been looking for a recipe for it for a long time. This was definitely the best recipe by far.

I decided to make this recipe because I had lots of left over BBQ shredded chicken from sandwiches I made a few nights ago. I threw this recipe together real fast, making the pizza dough in my bread maker. This pizza was delicous! It is super easy and fast to make for dinner. If you like BBQ sauce, you will most definitely like this pizza! In all honesty, I wasn't sure if I would like it, but it was delicous!!
Very good pizza recipe. I used a beer batter crust that i use with all pizza recipes and it was great. A sweet chipolte bbq as the base everyone ate it up!
This pizza was AMAZING!!! I used a mix of Jalepeno Jack and Habenero Jack cheese (from Trader Joes) and the pepperoncini pepper is a MUST! It adds a little kick to the pizza. So good!!
If your near a Trader Joe's, buy the pizza dough. Easy to make and super fresh. We bought garlic pizza dough.

used precooked chicken, homemade crust, subbed yellow and red bell peppers for the onion, and didnt use the full 2 cups cheese. i love cilantro so added more, and added some chopped bacon that needed to be used.
Good idea for a pizza. Love the combo. I used jalapenos.

loved it ! it was easy and the results were famblouse. quite fast too . so it basically depends of ur bbq sauce taste it before using it if you can imagine your self eating on a pizza crust then do it . i added salt to taste, 2 tbs of Parmesan cheese to sauce and chucnks of fresh tomatoes without squeezing the juices out . a sprinkled origami on the cheese . finally mixed quarter of the sauce 's cup with the toppings before adding
We liked this pizza, but I think the crust is what was "off" for us. Going to try it again with a different crust. I used a BBQ from this site "Grandpa Crott's" on this and it gave it great flavor.
Excellent pizza and I bet it would've been even better if I would've remembered the onion! With the baby I got distracted and forgot and so the next time I will remember.
Fabulous! Used Kraft Sweet & Spicy Chipotle BBQ Sauce and boneless skinless chicken thighs

Use grilled chicken, cooked crumbled bacon, green onions, Sweet Baby Rays honey BBQ sauce, cheddar & Monterey Jack. Any pepper & the cilantro overpowers the rest of the ingredients. I drizzle mine thinly with ranch dressing. Great the way it is, this is just a preference & another option, ;)

This pizza is sooooo good!!!We've had a frozen bbq pizza once(was a special from our supermarket) and we've been dreaming about finding it again ever since!This pizza didn't only taste as delicious but we can make it any time we want to!Thanks for sharing!
my friend made this for me for lunch one day, it was fantastic! She also topped with bean srouts and freshly queezed lime juice when it came out of the oven. really brightens up the flavor!
We love this recipe. It is so easy especially when we have leftover chicken. Very good.

i thought this was a great base recipe. ive never had the pepperoncinis on the pizza and i thought it could be good but my boyfriend said no! so next time i will try them on the side. i read most reviews and it said that a cup of sauce was too much, so i tried 3/4 C. and both me and my boyfriend thought it was too dry. i also thought 2 breasts was too much chicken. we are having it for dinner this week and i will try just 1 large chicken breast. i liked a little more cilantro. the best part of the pizza though was when i sliced the red onion VERY thing and let the ends get a little burned. it gave the pizza a great smokiness... wonderful! experiment and have fun with this one!!
All i can say is YUM! So easy to make too! I used a spicy and tangy bbq sauce, very good.

Excellent pizza! I used Sweet baby Ray's BBQ sauce, dried cilantro, smoked chicken leftover from another meal, and a five cheese italian blend instead of colbyjack cheese. I left off the peppers. I'm sure I didn't use a whole cup of sauce, I used a bottle with a squeeze top so I just squirted it on the crust, but it was maybe closer to a half cup worth. This got raves here and was the first pizza to go.

Great and easy! I poached and shredded my chicken mixing it with a small amount of BBQ before putting it on the pizza. I also used the colby-jack on half and mozzarella on the other half. I'm not sure which way was better. I put the cilantro on after it came out of the oven so it was easy to control the quantity on a piece by piece basis.
YUM!
This was great!!! All the flavors were great together. The cilantro and peppercinis made the pizza so don't omit them. Yummy, yummy. Thank you for this recipe.

Leave off the peppers and use smoked gouda instead of colby. Also if you want it really tender, use grilled boneless, skinless chicken thighs and shred them instead of cubing them. Then mix them together with the bbq sauce. (Use a little less sauce to spread on the crust. And GRILL the pizza on your grill...charcoal or gas...for the absolute BEST flavor. (You can go to the related article on Grilling Pizza on this site if you've never grilled a pizza...you don't know what you're missing!!!)
LOVED IT! We added a little sriracha hot sauce to sweet baby rays bbq sauce. It was excellent!
Grilled it on a charcoal grill, great flavor!
This pizza was very blah. I followed recipe exactly. I made two different pizzas that night (good thing) and this one was a bust with everyone. :(
Easy and great tasting. Add a bit of crumbled bacon makes this even better. Pepperocini on pizza is my favorite. I used Famous Dave's Texas Pit BBQ - it's a got a nice kick.

I subbed vegan "chicken" (Gardein) and vegan mozzarella for the meat and cheese. I added carmelized onions and one roasted red pepper (diced) to mine. I used my favorite (Stubb's Spicy) BBQ sauce. This pizza turned out FANTASTIC!!!

Absolutely delicious! I, too, just eyeballed the ingredients. I used homemade pizza dough from my breadmaker, canned chicken (because it was a lot quicker, and didn't taste any different), and added some water to the store-bought BBQ sauce to thin it out a little. I also left off the pepperoncinis. It was so yummy! I've made it twice now, and will definitely make it again in the future! So much cheaper than CPK!
delicious! Loved the cilantro. I used Tyson frozen grilled chicken strips. I heated them in a pan with some BBQ sauce while I prepped the remaining ingredients.
Yum, 1 said better than the local place, the other didn't agree. I liked it and it's all gone. I did leave out the cilantro because my husband doesn't like it.
Excellent and so easy!

Great pizza! I used a homemade crust and left out the peppers (because I don't care for them). I took one reviewer's suggestion to mix a little hot sauce into regular BBQ sauce. Excellent! I'll definitely be making this pizza again (and again and again)!

A really easy and tasty recipe! I left off the pepperoncini peppers (didn't have any) and cilantro (don't like it) and my boyfriend added crumbled bacon to his half. It was a fun change-up to our usual at home pizza toppings.
Such a delicious pizza! I also melted a little butter and garlic together and drizzled it on the crust before adding the other ingredients. I will definitely be making this again!!
Used Sweet Baby Rays BBQ Sauce, not that great. Needs a sweeter BBQ sauce for kids...
Pretty good! I reallly liked the banana peppers on it!

AMAZING! I boiled 2 chicken breasts with garlic cloves, salt, and water and then chopped it before I put it on top of the pizza. I can't believe how good this was because I normally don't like BBQ Chicken Pizza. I made this on a week night and will be making it again soon!
